Key Match Events: Ferran Torres scored the only goal of the match in the 13th minute.
David Raya made a crucial save from Kristjan Asllani's well-struck shot.
Joselu showed great agility to hook a volley over the bar from Alejandro Grimaldo's cross.
Armando Broja almost made an immediate impact off the bench but was denied by David Raya.
Pre-Game Insights: Spain coach Luis de la Fuente made 10 changes to the side that began the victory over reigning champions Italy.
Albania's thousands of fans created a fever pitch atmosphere as kickoff approached on a sultry summer evening alongside the River Rhine.
Post-Match Reflections: Julien Laurens praised Spain as they continue to impress after beating Albania 1-0.
Spain coach Luis de la Fuente received food for thought from several players as the business end of the tournament looms.
Spain matched their feat of 2008 when they also won every group game on the way to the title.
Albania's hopes of a first venture into the knockout rounds were crushed as they finished bottom of the group with one point.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Spain topped the group with nine points, with Italy second on four after they snatched a last-gasp 1-1 draw with Croatia who ended in third place with two points.
Albania's defeat meant France, Netherlands, and England progressed to the next round before their final group matches.
Spain wore a pastel-yellow second strip and controlled the tempo of the opening period.
